alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; St. Charles (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 24 at 4:03PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans and St. Charles. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 403 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. Intense rainfall rates of 1 to 3 inches or greater at times may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Avondale, Metairie, Marrero, Harvey, Jefferson, Harahan, Westwego, Elmwood, Bridge City, River Ridge, Waggaman, Ama, St. Rose, Estelle, Woodmere and New Orleans Armstrong Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
